ComputeNodeOperations

ComputeNodeOperations

ComputeNodeOperations
NOTE: An instance of this class is automatically created for an
instance of the BatchServiceClient.
Initializes a new instance of the ComputeNodeOperations class.

Constructor

new ComputeNodeOperations(client)

Parameters:
Name Type Description
client BatchServiceClient

Reference to the service client.
Source:
  • operations/computeNodeOperations.js, line 28

Methods

addUser(poolId, nodeId, user, optionsopt, callback) → {function}

Adds a user account to the specified compute node.

Parameters:
Name Type Attributes Description
poolId string

The id of the pool that contains the compute node.
nodeId string

The id of the machine on which you want to create a
user account.
user object

Specifies the user account to be created.

Properties
Name Type Attributes Description
name string <optional>

Gets or sets the user name of the account.
isAdmin boolean <optional>

Gets or sets whether the account should be
an administrator on the compute node.
expiryTime date <optional>

Gets or sets the time at which the account
should expire. If omitted, the default is 1 day from the current time.
password string <optional>

Gets or sets the password of the account.
sshPublicKey string <optional>

Gets or sets the SSH public key that
can be used for remote login to the compute node.
options object <optional>

Optional Parameters.

Properties
Name Type Attributes Description
computeNodeAddUserOptions object <optional>

Additional parameters
for the operation

Properties
Name Type Attributes Description
timeout number <optional>

Sets the
maximum time that the server can spend processing the request, in seconds.
The default is 30 seconds.
clientRequestId string <optional>

Caller
generated request identity, in the form of a GUID with no decoration such
as curly braces e.g. 9C4D50EE-2D56-4CD3-8152-34347DC9F2B0.
returnClientRequestId boolean <optional>

Specifies if the server should return the client-request-id identifier in
the response.
ocpDate date <optional>

The time the
request was issued. If not specified, this header will be automatically
populated with the current system clock time.
customHeaders object <optional>

Headers that will be added to the
request
callback function
Source:
  • operations/computeNodeOperations.js, line 91
Returns:

callback(err, result, request, response)

                 {Error}  err        - The Error object if an error occurred, null otherwise.

                 {null} [result]   - The deserialized result object.

                 {object} [request]  - The HTTP Request object if an error did not occur.

                 {stream} [response] - The HTTP Response stream if an error did not occur.

disableScheduling(poolId, nodeId, optionsopt, callback) → {function}

Disable task scheduling of the specified compute node.

Parameters:
Name Type Attributes Description
poolId string

The id of the pool that contains the compute node.
nodeId string

The id of the compute node that you want to disable
task scheduling.
options object <optional>

Optional Parameters.

Properties
Name Type Attributes Description
nodeDisableSchedulingOption string <optional>

Gets or sets what to
do with currently running tasks when disable task scheduling on the
compute node. The default value is requeue. Possible values include:
'requeue', 'terminate', 'taskcompletion'
computeNodeDisableSchedulingOptions object <optional>

Additional
parameters for the operation

Properties
Name Type Attributes Description
timeout number <optional>

Sets
the maximum time that the server can spend processing the request, in
seconds. The default is 30 seconds.
clientRequestId string <optional>

Caller
generated request identity, in the form of a GUID with no decoration such
as curly braces e.g. 9C4D50EE-2D56-4CD3-8152-34347DC9F2B0.
returnClientRequestId boolean <optional>

Specifies if the server should return the client-request-id identifier in
the response.
ocpDate date <optional>

The
time the request was issued. If not specified, this header will be
automatically populated with the current system clock time.
customHeaders object <optional>

Headers that will be added to the
request
callback function

reboot(poolId, nodeId, optionsopt, callback) → {function}

Restarts the specified compute node.

Parameters:
Name Type Attributes Description
poolId string

The id of the pool that contains the compute node.
nodeId string

The id of the compute node that you want to restart.
options object <optional>

Optional Parameters.

Properties
Name Type Attributes Description
nodeRebootOption string <optional>

Sets when to reboot the compute
node and what to do with currently running tasks. The default value is
requeue. Possible values include: 'requeue', 'terminate',
'taskcompletion', 'retaineddata'
computeNodeRebootOptions object <optional>

Additional parameters
for the operation

Properties
Name Type Attributes Description
timeout number <optional>

Sets the maximum
time that the server can spend processing the request, in seconds. The
default is 30 seconds.
clientRequestId string <optional>

Caller
generated request identity, in the form of a GUID with no decoration such
as curly braces e.g. 9C4D50EE-2D56-4CD3-8152-34347DC9F2B0.
returnClientRequestId boolean <optional>

Specifies if the server should return the client-request-id identifier in
the response.
ocpDate date <optional>

The time the
request was issued. If not specified, this header will be automatically
populated with the current system clock time.
customHeaders object <optional>

Headers that will be added to the
request
callback function

Reinstalls the operating system on the specified compute node.

Name Type Attributes Description

The id of the pool that contains the compute node.

The id of the compute node that you want to restart.

Properties
Name Type Attributes Description

'taskcompletion', 'retaineddata'

updateUser(poolId, nodeId, userName, nodeUpdateUserParameter, optionsopt, callback) → {function}

Updates the password or expiration time of a user account on the specified
compute node.

Parameters:
Name Type Attributes Description
poolId string

The id of the pool that contains the compute node.
nodeId string

The id of the machine on which you want to update a
user account.
userName string

The name of the user account to update.
nodeUpdateUserParameter object

The parameters for the request.

Properties
Name Type Attributes Description
password string <optional>

Sets the password of the
account.
expiryTime date <optional>

Sets the time at which
the account should expire. If omitted, the default is 1 day from the
current time.
sshPublicKey string <optional>

Gets or sets the SSH
public key that can be used for remote login to the compute node.
options object <optional>
